definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Many of the gold ornaments are melted down to be made into coins.
sentences.chinese: 很多黃金飾物回爐後鑄成了金幣。

sentences.english: Can I place tomorrow's gold in today's purse?
sentences.chinese: 我能把明天的金幣放進今天的錢袋裏嗎？

sentences.english: I will give you a package of gold coins, so please let me out.
sentences.chinese: 我給你一袋金幣，求求你讓我出來吧。

sentences.english: Azia still asked for nine hundred of gold for his horse.
sentences.chinese: 阿齊茲依然爲他的馬開價九百塊金幣。

sentences.english: He hung this around the mighty bullock's neck.
sentences.chinese: 他把金幣包掛在公牛的脖子上。

sentences.english: They finally found a small gold coin which was almost worthless.
sentences.chinese: 最後找到的是一枚幾乎一錢不值的小金幣。

sentences.english: The search was then finished on all the other attenders, however, the coin failed to appear again.
sentences.chinese: 很快其他人都通過了搜身，然而金幣還是沒有出現。

sentences.english: He gave the cobbler a gold coin and had the man show him Cassim's house.
sentences.chinese: 他給了補鞋匠一枚金幣，叫他指出凱辛的住處。

sentences.english: These coins were issued for only one year with a small mintage .
sentences.chinese: 這些硬幣發出了一年，只有一個小金幣。

sentences.english: As he did so, every piece of rice changed into a gold coin.
sentences.chinese: 結果，每粒被研磨過的米都變成了金幣。

sentences.english: We accept uncut diamonds and gold ingots , too.
sentences.chinese: 我們也接受未切割的鑽石和金幣。

sentences.english: Underneath these things were some papers tied up inside a cloth, and a bag of gold coins.
sentences.chinese: 這些東西下面還有卷在布里的幾頁紙和一袋金幣。

sentences.english: He sentenced people to death for trying to scrape the gold off of coins.
sentences.chinese: 他將那些試圖從金幣上刮取金子的人判處死刑。

sentences.english: Even gold coins are being hoarded as the yellow metal keeps breaking records.
sentences.chinese: 金幣收藏市場甚至像黃銅一樣持續打破紀錄。

sentences.english: That would make a gold standard practicable and not too deflationary.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就會使金幣標準可操作了因爲不會引起通貨緊縮。

sentences.english: I think they look like gold coins scattered on the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得像是在綠色田野中撒下來的金幣一樣。

definition: to count and check/to tally/points (collected in some bonus scheme etc)
lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
integral (calculus)/accumulated points (in sports, at school etc)/total credits earned by student/bonus points in a benefit scheme
